comment.text:
I should just head to Aviva by Kameel whenever I feel down. Not just because the food is stellar, which it totally is, but because Kameel himself is so chipper and enthused to see you, a total stranger, greeting you like an old pal. "Hello, my sister!"s, huge grins, and handing out free petite cups of a comforting, slightly spicy tomato-based soup would lift anyone's soul.

Kameel actually passed out falafel to us in the line before handing out the soup. I don't consider myself a falafel person but really found the steamy warm ball appetizing, with its crunchy exterior and soft interior and eyeball-like dots of sauce. Later he plopped a small square of baklava onto my tray alongside my lunch. This was the right combo of crunch, cinnamon, and sweetness. And finally, a woman came by with small plates of juicy watermelon cubes. So instead of one meal, I probably had 1.5.

It's not just Kameel who's super nice, all the other staffers were too. There was short wait even though it was the tail end of lunchtime. It was about 15 minutes from entering the queue to paying; at least the line moved regularly. I ended up getting the rosemary chicken platter which was $11.45 and came with two pita triangles and your choice of two sides. Plus a bonus falafel too. I got the eggplant ratatouille and mmjadara which was a lentil-brown rice blend with caramelized onions. It was all tasty. Packed with flavor. The chicken wasn't skimpy; I got a breast and thigh. The breast was slightly dry, but the thigh was perfectly moist. The skin and the sauce were the real highlights. The skin had a great blend of spices, salt, and citrus. I couldn't hear what the young man was saying about the chicken's sauce, but I didn't turn it down and that was the correct decision.

I couldn't eat the whole platter. If you want to elicit food envy from your coworkers, simply bring leftover rosemary chicken to the office and heat it up. Three people trilled "That smells so good!" at me. Too bad I couldn't pass off Kameel's creations as my own.

Aviva by Kameel is closed evenings and weekends. There are bathrooms right outside the restaurant and some inside as well. Tip with cash if paying by card.

It's a no-brainer why Aviva by Kameel is rated so highly on Yelp. The people who work around Peachtree Center and visitors in the area are lucky to have Aviva around!

Ordered: falafel platter with 3 sides ($11)

Ambience: inside the Peachtree center. very busy lunch place

Review: a little pricey but good quality food. I must have written a review on this spot in the past. So Aviva is a family run business. Kameel is the original chef and you'll see him walking around attending to customers. His customer service and unique business style really put this spot on the map of ATL. He remembers his customers name, brings out samples for folks to try. Everyday the line wraps around the shop during lunch hours. Its fresh and flavorful food. 

Falafel are deeply fried but you don't feel the excess oil. It reheats well the elme the day which tells you it's fresh. The falafel sizes are decent. Lentil soup - there are many variations of it depending on the day. I am a huge fan of lentil. Now if you've never had lentil soup before, you gotta try it at Aviva (and Sababa at Dunwoody). It's got right amount of spices infused in the soup and it's not spicy. Cream and spinach is actually very creamy. Has a good salt balance and it tastes smooth. As samples we got his blueberry muffins (delicious) and fresh watermelon. That took care of desert. Make a trip to Aviva. It's worth it!

The service here is phenomenal. They treat you like family. I get the veggie plate each time which has 4 sides. The soup is a must have. I get the creamy chicken soup and dip their bread in it. The lentils are delicious and thats coming from an Indian who grew up on lentils. It has these sauteed onions on top and whew. Delicious. Potatoes are delicious as well as the fan favorite, creamy spinach. 
They have all these sauces for you to put on top (i recommend the spicy sauce and the rosemary sauce). And you get a slice of watermelon!
I love it here & stop by once a week!

This is till date on of the best restaurant experience I had in Mediterranean cafe. The ambience of this place and the the Chef's warmth is what makes this place stand out. 

There is a huge queue waiting to be taken care off and the chef himself walked in with a few samples of give aways to cheer the crowd. I liked the lentil soup and the baklava before I ordered. 

I ordered The Beast and the rosemary chicken. Both of them were perfectly cooked and rolled. The chicken was perfectly done and the meat just felt like it was falling of the bone. The had a perfect blend of spices mixed. I will visit this place every time I'm in this mall.

Chef Kameel always has great food. I've eaten at his restaurants the entirety of my college years and honestly miss his food. Will be by soon! I'd highly recommend for anyone needing high quality food on a casual weekday.

Absolutely delicious and the staff is incredibly friendly. Their chicken soup was out of this world and the rosemary chicken was delicious as well. Highly recommend coming here. It's tucked in the peach tree center.

I haven't been here for some time but I bring it up out of Georgia all the time. A pleasant surprise in a mall. The owner greets everyone, last time handing out free filfafel cooked in olive oil. A great experience for those from and outside of Georgia. Does the city proud!
Best service i ever received in my life!! If i can give more stars i would. Highly recommend to all

Aviva was the closest good and healthy place near my hotel during my visit to Atlanta. Although the hours on yelp say that they're opened in the morning, this is only for their juice cafe. They don't start serving lunch until 11:00am. 

For a place in a food court, Aviva is awesome. They have a variety of fresh and hot Mediterranean food items. The pricing and portions could be a little better when you're getting the food to-go, but given the restaurant quality taste of the food, I'm willing to pay a little extra than if I were to go to some place like a Daphne's. During my visit here, I got to try the salmon and lamb shawarma. Surprisingly, the salmon was the better protein for me. It was moist and perfectly seasoned. I had high expectations for the lamb shawarma but it was too heavily spiced and salty for me to really enjoy. The side dishes I got were all good, but a stand out was their hummus. Next time I stay in the Marriott marquis Or the Hyatt regency, I'll definitely cross the skybridge to grab lunch here.

This place is awesome!!! The food was delicious and a great price for the quantity. The chef was also super sweet and was walking around and talking to the customers as if he were greeting old friends. They also offered tasty vegan options, don't forget to try the baklava it's delightful!

We have been to the location inside the Coda building several times and live the food. We always get free soup and lots of recommendations from the staff. The owner is very friendly. It has not been too busy when we have stopped by.

The pizza is a delicious homemade style which is not often found elsewhere. The atmosphere is fun because of the eclectic group of customers. You get Georgia Tech students to people dressed in formal attire.

This place is pretty great. Since it is in the food court the hours are hard to catch and parking in the area is STRESSSFUL. 

Though.

If you are around and you have at least an hour, definitely stop by. It is located in a busy cafeteria that people coming from conventions and the local hospital staff frequent. There is usually a line during lunch time, but these people crank out the orders so you'll get your food. 

I've had the;

Chicken Shawarma - my favorite
Rosemary Chicken - Pretty decent, kinda home made feel.
Falafel - pretty good
Mmjadara - solid side

If you live anywhere near Atlanta and you haven't been to Aviva, what are you doing with your life? The staff is so incredibly inviting and the food is knock you over delicious. I haven't tried a single thing that I didn't like. You can't go wrong with the mujadarah and baba ganoush. It is warm and comforting and feels like a bowl of hugs.

Tasty and fresh. Great service. Kameel is charming 

Portions are generous. Great value.

photos.caption: Free soup and baklava. Kameel himself hands it to me while I'm in line.  What a great host

comment.text:
I love eating at Aviva. Food is top notch. 
Vegetarian platter is delicious.
Pasta and soups are amazing. 
Kameel and his family are so welcoming. I always walk out with a big smile.

This has to be the best Mediterranean food I have had in decades. I have had Mediterranean food in Mediterranean countries and this is better than most. They obviously use the freshest ingredients and the chef is extremely talented. I had about 5-different dishes here and they were all delicious.

I consider this restaurant a hidden gem--it's not a place you'd just walk by, so most people know it exists only by word of mouth.  That's how I learned of it, and I'm glad I did.  Healthy options, generous portions and delicious, flavorful food.  Highly recommend!

Ya'll. The stories are true. This place cannot be missed. These folks have continued to receive "Best of..." awards for good reason. The food here is stellar and it's paired with quick, friendly service. 

I ordered the chicken shawarma platter and my sides included grilled veggies and half hummus/half baba ganoush with some pita bread. The platter also came with a well seasoned and perfectly crisp falafel. I, as a self proclaimed condiment queen, added tahini sauce and hot sauce to my shawarma and falafel for a little extra kick. Highly recommend adding those to your meal, at least on the side! 

Let's start with the chicken shawarma itself, shall we? Absolutely freakin' delicious. Tender chicken breast cut into strips, seasoned wonderfully with their Turkish spices. Mixed with a little house hot sauce and some tahini, you've got a wonderful mix! The grilled veggies included squash, zucchini, carrots and broccoli which were all fresh and seasoned with olive oil and salt and pepper. Now to the creamy corner of my platter - the hummus and baba ganoush. Holy moly, these were rich and savory. The hummus, which is chickpea based with garlic and tahini, was thick and simple with olive oil drizzled on top. The baba ganoush was probably my favorite cold side as it's eggplant based and absolutely divine. The two pieces of pita were fresh and perfect for dunking into these creamy dips!

This is food you can feel good about because they cook with locally sourced ingredients and serve only hormone and additive free meats. I didn't see Kameel on this particular visit, but I look forward to meeting him at future visits because this place leaves you wanting to come back for more!

Aviva has plenty of their own seating but The Hub (how they are now referring to the Peachtree Center food court) has updated dining area including bar seating and updated booths and tables. They are still under construction as of this post (3/11/19) but hopefully the end result will just mean more success for this awesome eatery!

Overall, a wonderful experience and looking forward to many future visits!

photos.caption: Chicken Shawarma platter w/ Grilled Veggies Grilled Veggies Hummus Baba Ghanoush Falafel & Pita Bread

comment.text:
Excellent food, generous portions, nice staff-great place to eat when in Atlanta for a convention.  Look for it in the food court, near the entrance up the stairs from the street, or through tone of the overhead tunnels from the surrounding hotels. The owner will come out into the dining room to greet you and welcome you. We will definitely be back. 

Food: 5/5  It's cafeteria style and the food is replenished frequently. We liked the rosemary chicken, lamb  schwarma,and chicken schwarma,  and all the vegetable sides -the  mixed fresh vegetables are lightly steamed(not cooked to mush); the spinach and the  lentils are nicely seasoned dishes;; the pita is fresh, and the salads are fresh.  On the day we were there the owner brought small slices of watermelon out to the people waiting in line -a very. Ice gesture. Food is packaged in cardboard so you can do carry-out if you don't want to eat on-site. 

Staff 5/5-friendly, pleasant, helpful. Even the welcomes you.

Facility-5/5 clean, modern and there are a few tables inside the serving area. If they are full or if you prefer-there are tables out in the main lobby of the food court.  

Location 4/5 The food court is large, with several types of restaurants and food-and This restaurant is near an entrance .and is larger than some of the fast good places, but Look for the sign! It is inside a glass enclosure. The food court itself is an easy walk from the surrounding hotels BUT IT IS NOT EASILY ACCESSIBLE FOR DRIVERS because of the parking. .  Street parking is $12 per hour. The parking rates near it are up to $20 for one hour at the local hotels" parking garages-  like the Marriott Marquis -so Park in one of the overground parking garages across the street for $2 each 20 minutes ($6 per hour)  The food is worth the $6 parking fee for the hour you will be there.

I'm a foodie. This by far the best Mediterranean place I've eaten. I've had falafel in Israel and Aviva is way better. Olive oil is used in their food, clean food. The spices are by far the best used on their chicken and breads. Try this place you will love it!!!

Aviva by Kameel Downtown at Peachtree Center in Atlanta is a great place to go for all things Mediterranean food. Everything that I have tried from here has been flavorful and delicious and something different that was much appreciated. The staff here is very efficient and provides excellent customer service.
Incredibly fresh food.  Love it.  I stop by whenever I'm in midtown. Service is always great

Had a free day in Atlanta waiting for my flight and after looking up places to eat, we had to try this place out because of its great reviews! 

The food was pretty good, I got a falafel wrap and my boyfriend got the chicken shawarma. The falafel was really moist compared to other ones I've had before, and the hummus was really tasty and flavourful! I do warn anyone that usually like hot sauce on their food that theirs is VERY hot! 

Overall the service was good, and they provided a few free samples for customers to try out (their soup sample was amazing).

Wow! My colleague's and I were in Atlanta for business and found this place on Yelp.  We were greeted by the owner immediately and given complimentary soups from the back.  We had the baked chicken which was full of intense flavors. He then gave us some free baklava  which was the BEST I've ever tasted(we ended up buying anther serving)! I definitely recommend this place and will be coming back  the next time I am in Atlanta.

Great service! I was helped making a decision on what to eat...there was so much to choose from and the aroma of food was amazing! With the help of a kind lady behind the counter I decided on a veggie plate, mixed vegetables, potatoes and onion, hummus and a cucumber tomato delicious salad mix. Very knowledgeable and friendly staff. Fresh and flavorful food. Very clean gem in Atlanta.

Came here to try out this 5-star place during a business trip. I was amazed by the service they provide here. On a Tuesday around 12:10pm, it was packed with a long line waiting outside this cute place. We were waiting outside when the owner took out some free samples of sweet potato pies and tomato-based soup for us to try. He was so passionate and cares so much about the customers. This makes the customers happy and also his employees love to work there.

Food is amazing! They offer a good selection. Actually we came back for a second time. Ordered lamb for the first time and chicken for the second. Personally I prefer the chicken. It is more favorable and not that dry.
Food with heart. Consistently exceptional Mediterranean fare. The schwarma is great and so is the fresh falafel. If you're lucky enough to be greeted by Kameel it will make your day.

My point is 5 stars!
I finally got the reason why here is the best review restaurant in Atlanta.
If you wonder, go yourself and feel directly! There are not like super special things, but the most important thing is there are also no bad things.
And the chef's passion is very interesting!
The one thing that is little uncomfortable is finding a parking area and expensive downtown parking fee. But, you know, I'll have this food again, even though I have to pay the expensive parking fee. LoL

Be healthy. Make healthy society!

Well darn. I was so excited for this place. The service was super lukewarm bordering on brisk. My grilled veggies were nearly raw, the eggplant was mostly peel, and I found the quinoa bitter. The bread was a spongy, tough, cornbread type deal that had a metallic almost baking soda-like flavor. The sweet potatoes were delicious but so sweet it was like a dessert. The aromatic olives added on the side tasted exactly the way banana boat sunblock tastes. Perhaps a strong coconut flavor is to be expected? For a place lauded as being a top lunch spot, I left deeply disappointed and still hungry. It's hard judging restaurants by their vegetable options but my gripes seemed grounded in poor preparation and lack of attention to detail. How those veggies could have visually looked done is beyond me. My experience seems atypical but wanted to share it regardless.

My friend recently had a baby and I offered to bring her and her husband dinner and she chose Aviva by Kameel. I hadn't heard of it before, but I am so grateful she brought it to my attention!

First, ordering online was super easy and convenient. I loved that I could order earlier in the day and schedule a pick up time that was convenient to me. 

When I arrived, I quickly noticed how clean the establishment was. I was also welcomed warming by two employees. My food was hot, ready to go upon arrival and packaged with care. All utensils and napkins were included which seems like a silly detail to note, but during COVID, a surprising number of restaurants are not doing that for to go. 

And now to the food. WOW it was delicious. My friends and my husband both got the chicken shawarma and gave it rave reviews. I had the falafel and it was great! As sides, we tried the hummus sweet potatoes and grilled veggies. Next time, I want to try the baba ghanoush and mmjadara. 

A great find in Midtown and Downtown Atlanta.

My experience at Aviva by Kameel was one of the better culinary experiences I've enjoyed in recent memory.

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

Before I even set foot in the line at Aviva I got a taste of what an amazing experience I was about to have. Kameel Srouji himself was walking to and fro, handing out free samples and laughing and joking with the crowd to ensure everyone in what was about a fifteen minute lunch line had smiles on their faces: it worked. "I love you!" he would say as he handed out soup before going back to ensure the culinary assembly line was going okay and giving some feedback here and there. It's rare that I know that I'm going to write a five star review before even laying eyes on the food but I knew that's what was going to happen here. Kameel's warmth is simply the definition of what dining out should feel like. From there things only got better with a fresh wrap that was made right in front of me. Star. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

At $14.95 my wrap wasn't cheap, but that was certainly the case once you realize that this could have easily been two full meals. Star. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

How could I have not loved this wrap? It was made literally right in front of me with a swath of fresh ingredients that couldn't have been better as they were brought together. I opted for mixed meat lamb and chicken, and they came together brilliantly with the fresh greens, veggies, and a sauce of my choosing. Excellent. Two Stars. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

There's a reason that Aviva by Kameel is the highest rated restaurant in Atlanta. Star.

As a student at GSU, I'm fairly close to the bustling food scene in ATL. I saw that Aviva is one of the best places to eat in ATL so during a break between classes i decided to stop by. I'm so glad I made the walk over here. Aviva is by far one of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had!

Aviva is a small Mediterranean restaurant located in a food court within Peachtree Center. When I walked in I was expecting a order and pick up style menu but was surprised that all the options of food and combinations were laid in a buffet style. Since this place is so popular, the line till you get to order your plate was really long but Kameel Srouji and other employees would walk down the line handing out fresh samples to everyone. His generosity and happy attitude made this the most enjoyable time I've ever spent waiting for food. 

As I finally ordered, Mr. Srouji was back behind the glass welcoming everyone to his restaurant letting each person know how much he appreciates that they stopped by. For this trip I went ahead and ordered the Chicken shawarma, Eggplant ratatouille, some baked potatoes, with a falafel and pita bread. 

The Chicken shawarma was a burst of flavor, and was only complimented with the sauce of the eggplant ratatouille. Both are best enjoyed as a hot and fast as possible. I could not guess the seasoning used for the baked potatoes but they were phenomenal none the less. 

If you are a student in the ATL area, one of the employees working around Peachtree Center, or just visiting, Aviva will be a restaurant experience you will never forget!

I've picked up from here twice since COVID began, and the food has been delicious both times. To pick up, they just ask you to pull up in front of Gibney's Pub and then call. They'll bring the order right out to you. 

I think the chicken shwarma platter with sides of baba ganoush and falafel is going to be what I order from now on. The spices/seasoning is amazing and they complement each other perfectly. My friend ordered an entree of falafel and a side of it too, and they forgot his entree portion, but I know this process is new. Our second order was perfect though.

The baba ganoush side is always generous and I usually have some left over. Great to eat with grilled vegetables the next day!

I always love stopping by hear you grab a nice lunch during a busy day. I always enjoy the chicken shawarma or the rosemary chicken. I have tried the salmon, it was decent, but I'm not a fan of the price for lunch. 

You can always expect a warm welcome and friendly gesture from the owner who comes around to greet the many guest with little treats and samples of the day. The staff truly reflects the owner and they are just as warm and friendly. 

This place is definitely a must go if your in the Peachtree center area for lunch hour.

Whether you're ordering takeout or dining in, the experience at AVIVA is one worth having and traveling for. Fast-casual but it's anything but ordinary. Pre-COVID the lunch line would be wrapped around the restaurant,  but DON'T FEAR THE LINE.  The owner would greet you with such warmth and offered your samples, etc as you waited. The service was absolutely top notch when you went to order and the food is just perfect; very flavorful and authentic (and take it from a Lebanese girl - this is top notch stuff). I highly recommend the falafel - it's so crunchy and tasty; I could honestly sit and eat an entire tray as a snack. 

Please support this business. It's an Atlanta gem.

This was such a good lunch experience. The line was a bit long when we walked in, but we were served free soup as we waited in line. I got a "salad" but was served a lot of protein and grilled vegetables. It was a lot of food for the price. The owner was serving us, and it really showed he much care goes into the food and service.

Maybe I'm super americanized in that I don't want to argue about the food I'm buying. The honey calls it his 'authentic turkish grandma experience,' "What, you don't want my food? Why don't you love me?!"

So for myself, when you hand me something and I can't eat it and you tell me to throw it away or when I request to add something on top and I'm asked if I'm sure. I say yes. I'm asked why. I say why. I'm told oh its fine. I say no thank you and tell them again what I want. I'm asked If I'm sure.

That's when your need to haggle with me about my food has made my decision on this experience complete. 

No thank you. Never ever again.

I have been coming here throughout the years as a visitor to Georgia, and have meant to leave a review. Every time it is consistently good, clean, and the best employees. This time I have come during Covid, and was thoroughly pleased with the service and cleanliness.  This time there weren't any long lines, so I got my food to go in minutes. Everything tastes great on the menu, and usually someone is their handing out samples. This time, I got the seafood soup (which is my favorite and has tons of different fish and shellfish), baba ganoush, and the cabbage salad, and a limoncello la croix. Honestly everything there is delicious.

Best Mediterranean food I've ever had! Free samples while you wait in line, handed out by the owner, who might be one of the kindest humans I've met in many years. Hummus is incredible. Salmon is succulent and so flavorful. Best baclava ever! Highly recommend.

Mmm. Best: seafood soup, lamb kafta, creamed spinach (a bit spicy!), salmon, lentils, falafel (lightest ever!). Good: sweet potatoes, mixed veggies. Less than good: nothin'. 

Go there!

As you can see from photo, this was damn good!! I got the veggie/falafel platter with mixed veggies, chefs special side, baba ghanoush, & green beans. I tore it up before I said grace {sorry Lord}! 

Chef Kameel came out to the dining area to offer some stir fry he just whipped up, which was delicious! Organic spinach, mushrooms, tomatoes, peppers, & a little asiago cheese. Yum! His personality is beautiful & you can tell through his cooking. 

I finished the meal with the pistachio baklava, topped with organic maple syrup!

This is a must try! I throughly enjoyed myself

photos.caption: I honestly meant to take a picture before I dove in, but I failed lol

comment.text: A food court experience quite unlike any other I've had. Expect a long line, made palatable by the fact that Kameel will bring around samples to whet your appetite (he may also proclaim his love for you in the process). The line moves quickly, so it can be a little disorienting when you finally get to counter, if you haven't yet decided what you're ordering. Food-wise, I'd say my chicken shwarma plate was solid 4* (and easily made for two meals). Everything was good, but nothing was exceptional. The ingredients seemed of good quality, and nothing was overly oily or salty (one or the other typically ruins Mediterranean food for me). I'll definitely return, but will likely try something different when I do.

photos.caption: Line to get into the store for a weekday lunch

comment.text: Wow. This place was FANTASTIC! I was attending a work conference nearby and my colleagues & I needed a quick lunch that was as healthy as we could manage, so luckily we stumbled upon Aviva. We were given soup samples by who I presume to be Kameel, who greeted us with such warmth and kindness. I got the chicken shawarma plate with sweet potatoes and tabouli--all so flavorful and excellent! I was also given some bread and a piece of falafel, which both were unbelievably tasty! I added both the tahini and rosemary sauce to my chicken and it was ridiculously delicious. All of us raved about our meals & we tried to come back on Saturday when it was unfortunately closed. Next time I'm in Atlanta I will go out of my way to get another meal here. Just wonderful.

I was surprised and a bit disappointed to see that Yelp's best rated Atlanta restaurant is in a perpetually under construction food court below a downtown office building. But what a smart business decision to locate here. Weekends off and endless lunch traffic.

I ordered the chicken shawarma platter with baba ganoush and creamy spinach. The chicken was tasty but a little dry, helped by the tahini sauce and hot sauce. The baba ganoush was as good as any I've had, and the spinach had an unexpected and fun little spicy kick to it.

Owner Kameel roamed about and schmoozed, telling everyone "I love you". This would be awkward and strange from anyone else, but it works for him.

I really wanted to be able to give Aviva three or four stars, just on principle, but in all fairness I can't. It's really good.

photos.caption: Chicken shawarma, baba ganoush, creamy spinach.

comment.text: I go here at least 4 times a month, I'm guaranteed fresh ingredients, a friendly staff and food that's off da chain. So, if you are downtown or midtown check them out, they have 2 locations. I always order the crunchy but soft inside falafels, sweet potatoes, tabouli, sometimes, I'll have a falafel wrap, so good!

Line forms early and I now know why! Wow! Trust the awesome reviews - it was SO GOOD. Met a friend for lunch and he told me about this place tucked away in the food court. Got there around 11:40am on a Tuesday - line out the door. Left around 1pm. Line still out the door. Line moves pretty quickly and they handed out small cups of tomato, parmesan, basil soup to enjoy during the wait. Almost did not have time to finish my soup by the time we could order. Owner was walking around complimenting people and joking that you can only have 3 cups if you are driving 

Right before we reached the counter someone else offered us a sample of some blueberry treat. 

I ordered the Lamb Shawarma platter and the lamb was amazing!!!!! Shaved right there off the vertical rotisserie with tasty seasoned edges. Portions were plenty, sauces were flavorful. Once at the table, another person came around with plates of chopped up watermelon and fruit for us if we wanted it. 

This place is a friendly, well-oiled machine of mediterranean deliciousness. It is clear that it matters to them that we came in and they appreciated our business. The seating is also not crowded and the atmosphere is quiet so you can hear other talk over lunch. LOVED IT. LOVED IT.

photos.caption: Line in front - don't worry, it's WORTH it.

comment.text:
Very nice man, he greeted everyone entering the store and said goodbye to everyone leaving. We have been coming here for 6 years, And my father having an Iranian background developed a close relationship with Mr.Kameel 

11/10 definitely will return

I followed the hype and, boy, I'm glad I did! This is hands down the best Mediterranean food I've had at a U.S. restaurant. As good as a Lebanese friend's (shhhh, don't tell). Friday about 1:30 - only a 5 min wait. The owner did, indeed, come out with a warm greeting and samples of a lovely vegan soup. 
I got chicken schwarma because they were out of lamb. Sides were the perfectly cooked grilled veggies and the awesomely tart green cabbage salad. I could eat this every. Single. Day.
Thanks Yelp for steering me here! If you're in downtown ATL for a visit or work, this place can't be missed. Note - lunch only Mon-Fri.

photos.caption: Chicken schwarma, green cabbage salad, grilled veggies, falafel.

comment.text:
Nothing could be better than the actual owner, Kameel.  The sweetest most caring most amazing personality.  He knows you, he lets you know he remembers you, he's incredibly kind, he's attentive to his customers, and he visits the waiting line with trays of samples!  This man is a class act, and his family works behind the counter so the whole place runs as a beautiful unit.

This is such a special place.  The food is out of this world delicious, healthy, and I believe it's almost all dairy free (he can tell you what is not).  Everything is tasty, and you can have a huge lunch and not feel like an unhealthy slug afterward!!!  

The salmon is to die for with the caper sauce. Runner up is the tomato soup!
